newsitem.title: GERMANY: Paribas downgrades DePfa to sell from hold.
newsitem.headline: Paribas downgrades DePfa to sell from hold.

text.p: Paribas Capital Markets said on Tuesday that it had downgraded German mortgage lender DePfa Bank to "sell" from "hold", saying that speculation of a takeover by UBS was overdone.

DePfa said earlier that it believed that Swiss giant UBS had amassed a nine percent stake, which UBS denied. UBS said it held less than one percent in DePfa adding that it had no intention of taking over DePfa.
"We believe a take-over of DePfa is unlikely and makes no obvious economic sense for UBS," Paribas said in a research document.

"We do not believe that UBS will fork out some billion marks to acquire a bank with a RoE of five to six percent, particularly if it first needs to restructure the little profitable property finance business," Paribas said.
Shares in DePfa were up 7.50 marks at 87.50 marks in afternoon IBIS trade. The share surged nearly 13 percent to 91 marks earlier on.
